newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican police kill bank robber, end hostage drama.
newsitem.headline: Mexican police kill bank robber, end hostage drama.

text.p: Mexican police on Monday shot dead an armed bank robber who had been holding at least two hostages at gunpoint, ending a five-hour drama, much of it played out on live television.

Minutes before he was shot and killed, the robber, who answered to the name Gerardo and wore a white baseball cap pulled low over his face, came to the door of the bank holding two hostages at gunpoint.

The holdup at a Bancomer branch in eastern Mexico City began earlier on Monday with a brief shootout that injured one police officer and one civilian. After the shootout, about a dozen hostages were released.
Gayne Quiroz, 19, told Reuters that a man armed with a hand grenade led the assault and initially took about 15 hostages. She was released with about a dozen others.
The Mexican government news agency Notimex said one officer was injured in the hand and a civilian was shot in the leg during the brief shootout as police arrived at the start of the robbery.
At least 100 police officers surrounded the bank and closed off nearby streets.
